alert.note: Alert for Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Halifax County through 715 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alton, or near Turbeville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Turbeville... Hitesburg... Cluster Springs... Alton... and Virgilina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central North Carolina...and south central Virginia.
